description: Meshery manages entities in accordance with their specific capabilities. This field explicitly identifies those capabilities largely by what actions a given component supports; e.g. metric-scrape, sub-interface, and so on. This field is extensible. Entities may define a broad array of capabilities, which are in-turn dynamically interpretted by Meshery for full lifecycle management.

schemaVersion.description: Specifies the version of the schema to which the capability definition conforms.

displayName.description: Name of the capability in human-readible format.

description.description: A written representation of the purpose and characteristics of the capability.

anyOf.description: For capabilities related to entities configuration  like config, labels , annotations,etc
For capabilities related to visualization of entities like labels , styles
For capabilities related to lifecycle mamangement of entities like deploy, undeploy ,start, stop, restart, etc
For capabilities related to interaction with  like edit , delete , ui interactions etc
For capabilities related to integration  like  relationships,etc
For capabilities related to security like policies , rbac, etc
For capabilities related to performance  like load testing, performance testing, etc
For capabilities related to workflow like CI/CD, GitOps, etc
For capabilities related to persistence like database, storage, etc
For capabilities related to communication with the entities like logstreaming , messaging, etc
Catch all for capabilities related to actions on entities like delete,run, execute, etc

type.description: Classification of capabilities. Used to group capabilities similar in nature.

subType.description: Most granular unit of capability classification. The combination of Kind, Type and SubType together uniquely identify a Capability.

state.description: State of the entity in which the capability is applicable.

metadata.description: Metadata contains additional information associated with the capability.
